result.execSummary:
The defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis; and pay and mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.
- Restitution set at $0 (zero).
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence imposed as to Milwaukee Case# 08CF01860; with 12 days credit.
Court ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dedrick Bryan Sallis

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

-  Court sets Restitution at $ 0  (zero)

As to Count  1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -   4  years, concurrent to the sentence imposed as to Milwaukee Case# 08CF01860  with  12  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -   2  years.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

As to Count  1:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count   2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count  2   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. 

Defense counsel advises Court there may be a resolution to this case prior to trial.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss, appearing as a friend of the court.  Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Case recalled.

Atty. Hotchkiss advises Court that defendant may qualify for their representation; potential conflict of interest must be checked.

Court will conduct the preliminary hearing in Branch 28.
Court orders preliminary haring adjourned to Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis, Pro Se in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Case is scheduled for indigency hearing on today's date.
Defendant may qualify for Public Defender representation.
Court orders case passed.

Clerk:  jms
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dedrick Bryan Sallis in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dedrick Bryan Sallis appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
